summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs may require veterans filing disability claims to undergo medical exams, which are often conducted by contractors. VA uses veteran feedback and other data to oversee the quality of the exams but could do more. For example, VA doesn’t collect feedback directly from contracted examiners—missing a key perspective to help identify exam quality issues. Also, VA awards financial incentives based on...
title: VA Disability Benefits: Additional Oversight and Information Could Improve Quality of Contracted Exams for Veterans
